section.title: Summary
section.para: The Element Matcher plugin searches for common text patterns (elements). Such elements can be hyperlinks, host names, email addresses and so on.
First, plugin highlights found fragments; second, it allows you to execute some actions on it (for instance, open a hyperlink in browser).
It can sound difficult, but suppose you have a text "http://google.com/" in opened document in jEdit and you just ctrl+click on it to open in browser.
Elements that can be found currently includes:

itemizedlist.listitem: URLs (http(s), ftp, telnet, gopher, mailto) and email addresses
local files (currently only absolute pathnames on Windows)
URN XML schemes used by some RFCs (starts with "urn:ietf:params:xml:")

section.para: Functionality is somewhat interleaves with "Hyperlinks" plugin, however, the latter highlights links only when you point on it and does not parse entire files.

listitem.para: Version 0.1, Requires jEdit 4.3pre16, Java 1.6 and CommonControlsPlugin 0.9.5
